options_popup_trusted_filter_description.message: Trusted filters can use powerful filtering rules modifiers which can be dangerous in the wrong hands. Do not check this box unless you fully trust it.

options_filters_filter_trusted_tag_desc.message: You chose to trust this filter

options_support_feature_request_descript.message: Suggest ways to improve the app

options_support_bug_report_description.message: If something doesn't work correctly in the program

options_support_incorrect_blocking_descr.message: If you see a missed ad or "broken" website

options_support_rate_description.message: Tell us what you think about AdGuard

options_support_discuss_description.message: Discuss on our forum, in social networks or on GitHub

options_about_update_not_allowed_details.message: AdGuard for Safari needs macOS Monterey (version 12) or later to install updates. You can continue using the app without updating, but ad blocking may become less effective

options_about_updates_not_found.message: AdGuard for Safari is up to date

options_about_update_downloaded.message: Nearly up to date! Relaunch AdGuard for Safari to finish updating.

description.message: Unmatched adblock extension against advertising and pop-ups. Blocks ads on Facebook, Youtube and all other websites.

options_general_desc.message: AdGuard for Safari is a free and open source software. We welcome your feedback and contributions. If you want to report a bug or request a feature, please head to our GitHub repo.

options_allow_acceptable_ads.message: Allow search ads and the self-promotion of websites

options_filters_empty_custom_filters.message: You don't have any custom filters yet

options_filters_custom_step_one_url_desc.message: Enter a valid URL of the filter subscription.
AdGuard will add this filter subscription.

options_filters_custom_step_three_desc.message: Unfortunately, your custom filter cannot be added due to an unexpected error.

options_allowlist_description.message: AdGuard does not filter websites from the Allowlist.

options_allowlist_inverse.message: Invert AllowlistUnblock ads everywhere except for the websites from the Allowlist

options_userfilter_description.message: You can add your own rules here. This option is recommended for advanced users familiar with HTML/CSS. Read the filter rules tutorial to learn how to write your own filter rules.

options_popup_update_version_error.message: The version of the filter you're trying to update is the same or older

options_popup_update_not_found_title.message: All filters are up to date

options_popup_update_error.message: Failed to get updates. Please try again later.

options_popup_version_update_title.message: AdGuard for Safari was just updated to version $1.

options_popup_version_update_description.message: This version contains mostly bugfixes and minor improvements.
This is a major extension upgrade that brings a lot of new features and improvements.

notification_content_blocker_overlimit_d.message: Too many filters enabled. Safari cannot use more than %s rules in one group.

options_content_blocker_overlimit.message: Too many filters enabled. Safari cannot use more than %s rules in one group.

tray_menu_protection_start.message: Ad blocking in Safari is on

tray_menu_protection_stop.message: Ad blocking in Safari is off

options_content_blockers_desc.message: Enabled ad blockers: %s out of 6 (each can contain up to %s rules)

options_compare_title.message: Try AdGuard Premium for better protection!

onboarding_safari_desc.message: Check the boxes next to AdGuard extensions in Safari preferences.

onboarding_tooltip_adguard_safari_icon_i.message: You can use this icon to manage AdGuard for Safari settings. For instance, pause blocking on a website, or block an ad manually.

onboarding_tooltip_adguard_safari_icon_w.message: Web Page Content access is required in order to make 'manual blocking tool' work.

onboarding_tooltip_adguard_safari_icon_b.message: Browsing History access is required to detect if AdGuard works on the website you're currently visiting.

onboarding_tooltip_adguard_advanced_bloc.message: This extension applies advanced blocking rules which are not supported by Safari Content Blocking API.
Web Page Content access is required to make advanced cosmetic rules work.
Browsing History access is required to detect what website you're trying to open so that it could find what advanced blocking rules should be applied.

onboarding_tooltip_adguard_safari_conten.message: Safari limits the maximum number of content blocking rules with %s per extension. This is not enough to handle all sorts of ads and trackers AdGuard blocks. That's why we provide 6 extensions, thus increasing that limit to %s.

notification_user_filter_updated_desc.message: A new rule was added to User rules:

options_show_tray_icon.message: Show AdGuard for Safari in the menu bar

options_launch_at_login.message: Launch AdGuard for Safari at Login

options_verbose_logging_desc.message: If Verbose logging is enabled, AdGuard Safari extensions will print additional information to the browser console

options_enable_hardware_acceleration_des.message: Enables hardware acceleration for settings window. Application restart is required

settings_import_error.message: An error occurred during settings import

settings_notification_extensions_text.message: You should enable all AdGuard extensions for correct ad blocking in Safari

settings_notification_cb_extensions_titl.message: Some AdGuard content blocker extensions are disabled

settings_notification_cb_extensions_text.message: You should enable all AdGuard content blocker extensions for correct ad blocking in Safari

settings_notification_update_interval.message: Please note that outdated filters decrease the quality of protection, so it's important to keep them up to date.

options_cb_rules_overlimit_info.message:
The limit of %s rules has been exceeded. Please disable unnecessary rules for the app to work correctly.
Enabled rules at the moment: %s (disabled rules: $2)

window_close_dialog_message.message: Keep AdGuard running in the background?

window_close_dialog_detail.message: This is crucial for AdGuard to keep the main process running in the background, otherwise it won't be able to automatically check for filter updates and manage filtering.

folder_check_dialog_message.message: AdGuard for Safari should be launched from the Applications folder.

folder_check_dialog_detail.message: Do you want to move it to the Applications folder now?
